thread.title: An unjust execution in Virginia
thread.title_full: An unjust execution in Virginia - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost.com
title: An unjust execution in Virginia
text:
Del. Patrick A. Hope (D-Arlington) bows his head as he participates in a moment of silence during an anti-death-penalty vigil in Arlington on Oct. 1 in reaction to the planned execution of Alfredo Prieto. (Jabin Botsford/The Washington Post) October 8 at 5:45 PM The Oct. 4 Metro article “ Bearing witness to a killer’s execution ,” on Virginia’s execution of Alfredo R. Prieto, omitted an important fact: Virginia killed Mr. Prieto while he had an appeal pending before the Supreme Court. While the article mentioned the “clinical professionalism of the execution,” the commonwealth’s failure to wait for the court’s decision before administering the lethal injection was neither professional nor just.
Zach Everson , Bethesda
The writer is a member of the board of directors for the Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty.
